reviewText: Transfers of ECHO BRIDGE (aka "Platinum Disc") public domain movies is about average. No sign of restoration on their 60 and 70 year old films, with none dubbed from pristine studio prints. Minor downside: this company superimposes a faint logo on-screen every so often. Major downside (of THIS set): overcompression to fit 4 hours on a single layer.The ensemble originally known as the Dead End Kids used different character names in later incarnations. As the WWII-era East Side Kids, Leo Gorcey portrayed 'Muggs' McGinnis and Huntz Hall was 'Glimpy' McGleavey. In the later Bowery Boys, Gorcey's moniker became Terence 'Slip' Mahoney and Hall went by Horace DeBussy Jones (aka 'Sach').The Kids (ESK): Hall, Gorcey, Bobby Jordan, Ernest 'Sunshine Sammy' Morrison, David Durand, Eugene Francis, Donald Haines, David Gorcey, Stanley Clements and Bobby Stone. Gabe Dell (GD) was also a series regular.SYNOPSES--FLYING WILD - A group of young aircraft plant workers suspect a doctor is spying for the enemy.KID DYNAMITE - Muggs the East Side boxing champ is kidnapped before his scheduled match against the West Side's best pugilist. Danny fights in his stead and wins. Muggs is convinced the abduction was a betrayal by his friend.LET'S GET TOUGH! - After Pearl Harbor is attacked, the patriotic kids want to enlist but are too young. Their efforts to be useful uncover a Japanese spy ring.  Un-PC stereotypes accurately reflect the times.SMART ALECKS - Danny helps capture a crook and receives a cash reward that he won't share with the gang. His greed backfires when the bad guy comes looking for him.Vol. 1 of this seriesfeatures "Bowery Blitzkrieg" (1941), "Ghosts on the Loose" (1943), "Mr. Wise Guy" (1942) and "That Gang of Mine" (1940).Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll ratings.(6.5) Flying Wild (1941) - ESK/Joan Barclay/Dave O'Brien/Herbert Rawlinson/Dennis Moore(6.5) Kid Dynamite (1943) - ESK/GD/Pamela Blake/Benny Bartlett/Minerva Urecal (uncredited: Lafe McKee/'Snub' Pollard)(6.1) Let's Get Tough! (1942) - ESK/GD/Tom Brown/Florence Rice/Robert Armstrong (uncredited: Patsy Moran/Pat Costello)(6.6) Smart Alecks (1942) - ESK/GD/Max 'Slapsie Maxie' Rosenbloom/Gale Storm/Roger Pryor/Herbert Rawlinson/Joe Kirk
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: This is a bit more comedic than than the Dead End Kids but along the same vein.  Meant for those of us that never grew up.  It is fun to watch without having to think too deeply.
summary: How can you go wrong with the East Side Kids?
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: I love this DVD. I was slightly taken back with "Let's Get Tough", as I had never seen this one before (and I thought I had seen ALL the East Side Kids/Bowery Boys movies). But after my initial shock I was reminded that those were the times they lived in. It is a lesson in history if nothing else. All in all I am thrilled with the product, and the service was great. I highly recommend this to anyone needing a "Bowery Fix." I never tire of watching these movies.
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: A great story told in the early part off the 1900's life in the big city's, this is a great comedy thr stars the best
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: The question when looking at these films is the quality of the print. I doubt the person who buys or considers buying this set is an East Side Kids novice. We have all seen them too many times to recall- the question is, how is the print? The answer is decent- better than a lot that are on the market but not to the standards of a true remastered upgrade.
summary: Do you like the East Side Kids?
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: I love the movie and used to watch the tv shows with my dad. It brings back good memories and I plan to collect them all! Excellent to watch for movie buffs.
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: Delivery was on time as promised. I really haven't gotten a chance to watch the whole DVD but I don't see that there will be anything wrong.
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1

reviewText: This disc is so compressed, that the movements look like painted animation! If Platinun Disc would release these as two to a disc, they would look much better. Don't bother with this 8-movie DVD set, you can not watch it!This is an "8-Movie" 2-disc box set of their previous individualy released "4-Movie" discs.Disc 1:MR WISE GUY - Similar to the Alpha/Gotham edition but with more artifacting from compression. Watchable.THAT GANG OF MINE - Unwatchable! So Compressed that it is annoying to try to watch.  However, it includes a scene missing from the Alpha/Gotham edition.GHOSTS ON THE LOOSE - Missing the opening titles! More compressed than other DVD releases of this title.  I strongly suggest the VCI East Side Kids Double Feature version of this title.BOWERY BLITZKRIEG - Good master, but compression shows. I suggest getting Platinum's individual release of this movie, it looks good.Disc 2:'NEATH THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE - Similar to the Alpha/Gotham edition but with more artifacting from the compression. Watchable.PRIDE OF THE BOWERY - Unwatchable! So compressed that it is annoying to try to watch. There is a trade-off, the Alpha/Gotham copy has distorted & noisy audio which you can not understand.MILLION DOLLAR KID - Similar to the Alpha/Gotham edition but with more artifacting from the compression. Watchable.BOYS OF THE CITY - Unwatchable! So Compressed that it is annoying to try to watch.Unless you plan to watch this on a 15" TV screen you had better look for other copies, even VHS copies!
summary: POOR DVD, full of heavy compression artifacting!
Title: East Side Kids: Volume 1
